result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chrisjon Jaret Hankins

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defendant Chrisjon Jaret Hankins in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Chrisjon Jaret Hankins. 
Not called on the record. 
Atty Griffis requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:27 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chrisjon Jaret Hankins in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense has received discovery in 22CF247 and requests a status date in about 60 days so they may receive discovery and a global offer for both the defendants cases.  Defense is to advise the court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:19 AM   File not called on the record.
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Chrisjon Jaret Hankins in court by zoom with attorney Justin G Griffis.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Griffis requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

01:49 PM Defendant Chrisjon Jaret Hankins in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Taylor Olson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared, Alyssa Jay for the State of Wisconsin.

 Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
